intro: Euphrasia cephalata, commonly known as the clustered eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a hairy texture. Euphrasia cephalata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
